qas.question: What was Avicenna not known for?
What is Avicenna's name not needed for?

context: In <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>March 2008<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, it was announced that Avicenna's name would be used for new Directories of education institutions for health care professionals, worldwide. The Avicenna Directories will list universities and schools <a1_0><b6_0>where doctors, public health practitioners, pharmacists and others, are educated<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The project team stated "Why Avicenna? Avicenna ... was ... noted for <a2_0><b7_0>his synthesis of knowledge from both east and west<a2_0/>.<b7_0/> He has had a lasting influence on the development of medicine and health sciences. The use of Avicenna's name symbolises the <a3_0><b8_0>worldwide partnership<b8_0/><a3_0/> that is needed for the promotion of health services of high quality."
